title: How can I disable "Store draft messages in encrypted format"
content:
The SendLater extension started telling me today that I must disable "Store draft messages in encrypted format". That feature shouldn't even be enabled because I don't ever want to use encryption in Thunderbird.

I found the setting, but I can't change it.

https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2023-08-29-08-10-37-6679da.png

Please help. How do I fix this?

Thanks.
creator: TechByter

title: Archive folders not showing since upgrading to the latest Thunderbird
content:
I've been on v102 and decided to give the Supernova version a go.

Installed and restarted TB, but when I expand my Archives folder, instead of seeing all archived messages in a year folder, I only see for the last couple of years. See the attached image.

In the previous version, I could see many more folders, going back to 2005 in one case.

Looking in C:\Users\USERNAME\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\PROLFILEID.default\Mail\pop3.live.com\Archives.sbd I can see all the files I expect, ie 2005, 2005.msf etc up to 2023 and 2023.msf, but the folders don't show up in TB.

Anyone any idea how I get these folders to show? Thanks
creator: MrYossu

title: Thunderbird 115 and the system tray icon
content: When I open Thunderbird, it dl's mail from the mail server, gmail, and an icon pops up in the system tray, the TB icon, with a red dot that tells me I have mail. When I hover over it it says something like "4 unread messages". In TB 102, after I read all the messages, the red dot would go away until a new message came in, then the dot would come back and hovering would get "1 unread message" Now the red dot is always there after I read all my messages, and as more messages come in, the number goes up, so if I get 3 more messages, and hover over it, it says "7 unread message". This can't be right, but I can't find a setting in Windows 11 or Thunderbird that addresses it. Please advise if you can. Thanks.
creator: rleibforth

title: The Saved Files tab gets reset with a new session
content:
Once upon a time the “Saved Files” tab was persistent in Thunderbird. I used to use it quite a lot, as it is waaaay easier to remember that something arrived via email than remembering or simply going where I saved it. Now it’s almost always blank, there is a rather useless “clear list” button (as it is almost always blank already), and I have to look in the file manager for files. Is there some fix for it? I cannot find any setting regarding it. Something in about:config, maybe?

The expected behavior should be having a persistent list, from session to session, as there is already in Firefox.

I really struggle to understand the logic behind deleting the list by default, why this got changed over time, and if it is for privacy surely there should be some setting for the user?

This is the Linux (ubuntu) version of Thunderbird, 102.13.0 (64-bit)

Thanks in advance, elstellino
creator: elstellino1

title: Thunderbird not responding after v115 update
content:
I have been using flatpak Thunderbird on Linux (PoP!_OS) for some time with no problems, but since the update to 115, Thunderbird regularly freezes with a "Thunderbird not responding" message, and I need to force close the app. Creating an event with the calendar was guaranteed to cause a freeze.

After a complete uninstall with `flatpak uninstall --delete-data Thunderbird` and adding back my mail account, Thunderbird now freezes instantly at launch and is completely unusable.

Any help to solve this would be appreciated.
creator: seth16

title: Odebrání mailového účtu
content: V Nastavení účtu (vlevo dole) je rozkliknutelná položka Akce účtu. Praví nápověda Ve verzi TB 115.1.1 Akce účtu už není. Pamatuji si ji
creator: karel.janata

title: TB Versions
content: I have installed a newer TB Version 115.1.1 by mistake and unfortunately my email address was used to yry and find my account. My old TB Version is 102.14.0. To import my old TB Files would I first need to uninstall the newer version and then download the older version on my new laptop and start again? Thank you!
creator: mjconquest

title: The wordwrap of a new mail triggers on plugin bar Quicktext
content:
Dear,

The wordwrapper that is used while writing a mail triggers on the Quicktext pluginbar.

In other words, When you have a lot of templates within the Quicktext plugin, the text will disappear from the screen when typing a long sentence.

This happens in version 115.0.0 or highter no issues in previous version: 102.9.1

Img1: example with Quicktext You can see that the text disappears from the rightside of the screen

Img2: example without Quicktext The text gets wrapped as it should, the text jumps to the next line
creator: p.nijmeijer

title: POP3 or IMAP
content: Two questions I need help with: 1. My old laptop died, could someone kindly let me know how would I find out if I had POP3 or IMAP settings in my TB Version 102.14.0. I have saved the Mozilla Thunderbird Folder from the old computer and I am trying to move data to a new laptop. I believe I need this to make sure I use the correct setting so I do not delete my old TB data files. 2. I see TB saved info settings shows verizon.net as host. I presume I use manual configuration and change to aol.com to find my TB data? Thank you.
creator: mjconquest

title: Thunderbird 115.1.1 will not update or allow me to update email password
content: I changed my password on my email server (ATT), and all of my devices send and receive emails just fine, EXCEPT for my PC which uses Thunderbird. I have followed the instructions for updating the password multiple times, and also confirmed that the password is correct. Yet any time I try to send/receive email on my account in Thunderbird, I get a notification that my password isn't working. Is there a fix for this, beyond following the Help instructions over and over, ad infinitum?
creator: jumblejim

title: lost files
content: I lost all my old files when I had to re install Thunderbird. How can I get them back?
creator: jblaurie

title: Problem sending meeting invites
content:
Hello, We have a problem in the latest version, namely when we create an event in the calendar and invite people to this event, these people do not get the invitation link. Only the invitation in the calendar of the person who created the event appears.

Is anyone able to help us, suggest what we can do to make it work in previous versions there was no such problem.
creator: k.radoch

title: Błąd w liście Korespondenci
content: Od kilku dni w kolumnie Korespondenci wszystkie wiadomości wyświetlają mi się jako jeden nadawca. Tymczasem pochodzą one od różnych osób, z różnych domen. Próbowałem użyć przycisku Napraw, restartowałem komputer i nic nie pomaga
creator: k.dulinski

title: Password Recovery
content: I am using Thunderbird 102.14.0 on a MAC. Thunderbird is not accepting my password. I tried to change to a new password but I am unable to accomplish this. I can get to settings then to saved passwords then the SMTP provider. It shows I last changed my password today but when prompted for the password I type it in the "enter your password dialog box but the dialog box keeps coming up. My password I changed to is not being accepted.
creator: ordazdan

title: Thunderbird Menu Bar
content: Accidentally delete WRITE from task bar. Can no longer send message. Tried to take a snap shot and now all task bar disappeared
